radiographic_examinations.findings: Enlarged retroperitoneal, pelvic sidewall, and inguinal lymph nodes on the right side, with the largest lymph node measuring 4 cm in diameter in the right groin.
Hypermetabolic lymph nodes involving the right external iliac, femoral, and inguinal regions, and the medial right thigh.
Nonspecific changes and no mass lesion.

radiographic_examinations.date: 39 weeks after the start of treatment
radiographic_examinations.findings: Regression of the pelvic lymphadenopathy but enlargement of the inguinal lymph node; progression of skeletal metastasis with a large lytic lesion in the upper thoracic region and a pathologic compression fracture.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Enlargement of the inguinal lymph node; new enhancing mass lesions consistent with metastasis in the left frontal, right frontal, and left temporal regions.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Nearly complete resolution of brain masses.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant reduction in the size of brain metastases.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Resolution of pelvic lymphadenopathy and absence of tracer uptake in the spine.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolution of inguinal lymphadenopathy and no other metastatic lesions.
